ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, you’ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage you’ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Three reasons you must play—or replay—LucasArts’ classic adventure: (1) The time-jumping story and quirky characters are as entertaining as ever. (2) So many clever puzzles and funny gags. (3) With beautifully updated graphics and sound, a slick new control scheme and developer commentary, this remaster was clearly a labour of love.

After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

ios.subtitle: A tale of five tree creatures

name: Abby Monkey Basic Skills Pre K
artistName: 22LEARN Toddler and Baby Learning Games, LLC

editorialNotes.standard: Scurry to victory with mountains of cheese by stealing from friends and evading the mousetrap in this lively digital re-imagining of the popular board game.

ios.subtitle: A story about love and life

editorialNotes.short: Game 7. An intimate and emotional love story.
editorialNotes.tagline: Game 7. An intimate and emotional love story.

editorialNotes.standard: What’s made OLO game one of our longtime multiplayer favourites? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for points—and slyly knocking an opponent’s discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennep’s all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.
With no time limit, you’re free to relax and fully explore every level in this hidden object game and discover all the secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

ios.subtitle: Play and care for the cute pet

name: Zoo Sounds - Fun Educational Games for Kids

ios.subtitle: The new king of card games
You'll play it again and again

editorialNotes.short: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.
editorialNotes.tagline: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

editorialNotes.standard: A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple idea—pruning trees—and shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. There’s no frantic pace, no demanding skills to master—only a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Dreamjob Kid's Doctor – My little hospital

editorialNotes.tagline: Keep the shop in top shape

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fuelled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a line—any line—and watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect coloured dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, it’s a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

What secrets lie in the shadows of this Apple Design Award–winning puzzler? By twisting and turning unfathomable objects, you cast shadows on beautifully rendered backgrounds; manipulate them just right and you’ll find shapes you’d never have expected—from rabbits to wrenches. Soothing ambient music and thematic backdrops make completing each challenge as much meditation as entertainment—while timers and achievements give each level a competitive feel.
editorialNotes.short: With stunning visuals and satisfying solutions, this game is one to savour.

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar – Play & Explore

editorialNotes.short: Get married, raise some kids - but don't give away that you're an octopus.

editorialNotes.standard: Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasn’t played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is India’s largest river—all our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether we’re dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply can’t get enough.

Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addictive gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche you’ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colourful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.
editorialNotes.short: Hit the slopes and outrun the avalanche.

ios.subtitle: Be a chef and cook food!

editorialNotes.standard: Baffling and wonderfully weird, Samorost 3 is so different from everyday adventure games that it’s impossible to describe what this amazing experience is actually like. We stumbled across brain teasers entirely by accident as we explored its eerie and beautiful world. There was no pressure to do anything other than marvel at what we found—which was easy.
editorialNotes.short: Wonderfully weird, this game blends adventure and brain teasers.

editorialNotes.tagline: Now with an infinite game mode
editorialNotes.standard: At a glance, hocus doesn’t look very complicated. You swipe to move a red cube along a latticework of plain grey beams. But don’t let the minimalist visuals fool you—the game’s intelligent, abstract puzzles force you to look at things in a new way, like a cubist translation of Monument Valley. As you progress, the levels quickly get complex. But the peaceful music and crisp design make spending time in its world a richly rewarding experience.

editorialNotes.short: Guide this charming couple on their trip to collect memories.

name: Look and Find® Elmo on Sesame Street for iPad

editorialNotes.short: Atmospheric art, a moving story, and an incredibly strong girl.

ios.subtitle: Roll the ball from cat to cat

name: Tsuro - The Game of the Path

editorialNotes.standard: This gorgeous digital board game couldn’t be any simpler to learn, but true mastery lies at the end of a long and winding path. As fans of Tsuro’s tabletop incarnation, we love how faithfully—and beautifully—the experience is re-created here. App-exclusive ways to play add new layers of depth, letting us get lost for hours among these tricky, twisty trails.
